According to the National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI), over 47 million American adults struggle with mental illness problems annually. You will play an important role in improving the mental health of individuals and reducing the suffering it causes in our communities by earning your Master of Arts (MA) in Clinical Mental Health Counseling at Franklin Pierce University. With our 1,200-acre living learning laboratory nestled between Mt. Monadnock and Pearly Pond, you’ll conduct important fieldwork on campus in the woods, wetlands, fields, lakeshores, trails and gardens. You’ll work on conserving and restoring critical habitats and finding sustainable solutions in the local community. With your knowledge of environmental policymaking and advocacy, you’ll be prepared to be a key player in the “green economy."
